description: TO AMEND S. RES. 1, DECLARING THAT FRANK L. SMITH IS NOT ENTITLED TO A SEAT AS A SENATOR FROM ILLINOIS, BY PROVIDING RETAIN HIS SEAT, MR. SMITH IS ENTITLED TO BE SWORN IN AS A THAT, WITHOUT EXPRESSING ANY OPINION REGARDING HIS RIGHT TO MEMBER OF THE SENAE UPON HIS PRIMA CASE

TO PASS S. RES. 1, WHICH AS AMENDED PROVIDES THAT FRANK SMITH BE DENIED A SEAT AS A U. S. SENATOR FROM ILLINOIS UNTIL FURTHER HEARING AND REPORT BY THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE OF THE SENATE.  (P.3-2, 162-1)

description: TO AMEND S. RES. 69, PROVIDING THAT HON. GEORGE H. MOSES (R., N.H.) BE ELECTED PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE PRO TEMPORE, BY SUBSTITUTING THE NAME OF KEY PITTMAN OF NEVADA FOR THAT OF SENATOR MOSES.  (P.690-1)

TO AMEND S. RES. 73, PROVIDING THAT DAVID S. BARRY OF RHODE ISLAND BE CHOSEN SERGEANT-AT-ARMS AND DOOR KEEPER OF THE SENATE, BY SUBSTITUTING THE NAME OF J. L. DOBELL OF MONTANA. (P.691-1)
TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE ON INTERSTATE COMMERCE THE RESOLU- TION S. RES. 83, AUTHORIZING AN INVESTIGATION OF PUBLIC UTILITY CORPORATIONS.  (P.810-1)

TO PASS S. RES. 52, FAVORING A REDUCTION OF TARIFF SCHEDULES AND THEIR CONSIDERATION AT THE PRESENT SESSION.  (P.1512-2)

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 744 (45 STAT. 689, 5/22/1829), A BILL TO FURTHER DEVELOP AN AMERICAN MERCHANT MARINE, BY CHANGING FROM FOUR TO FIVE THE NUMBER OF MEMBERS OF THE SHIPPING BOARD REQUIRED TO VOTE IN ORDER TO SELL VESSELS (UNANIMOUS CONSENT WAS RQUIRED BY PROVISIONS IN THE ORIGIN- AL BILL)
